visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chart with the following specifications: Chart type: areaspline, Chart title: 'Live Data', Axes and labels styling: Use Verdana font for labels, set font size to 12px, and color to #555 for axis labels, Data series: Fetch data from a CSV URL, Custom colors: Use #32CD32 for the areaspline color and a gradient fill from #32CD32 to #32CD3200, Additional configurations: Enable polling for live data updates, set the default polling time to 2 seconds, and allow the user to input a custom CSV URL and polling time.

announceNewData.announcementFormatter: function (allSeries, newSeries, newPoint) { if (newPoint) { return 'New point added. Value: ' + newPoint.y; } return false; }

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration is designed to render a live data chart using the 'areaspline' type. The chart title is set to 'Live Data', and the axes labels are styled with the Verdana font, 12px font size, and a color of #555. The areaspline series is colored with #32CD32 and features a gradient fill from #32CD32 to #32CD3200. The chart is configured to fetch data from a CSV URL, with polling enabled for live updates. The default polling interval is set to 2 seconds, and the user can input a custom CSV URL and polling time. The chart also includes accessibility features to announce new data points, ensuring a minimum announcement interval of 15 seconds.
